website_summaries.verdict: While a popular choice, we recommend Pampers for leak prevention and wetness control.
pros: Incorporates four layers of material to help pull moisture away from baby
Company offers an app that allows customers to earn reward points towards future purchases
cons: The Leak Lock system has the tendency to fail and result in leaks, especially after several hours in between changes

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT purchase these diapers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these diapers last week hesitantly after reading some questionable reviews. I wish I had not. We have had to bath our child four times this week because she was absolutely covered in poop. These diapers are the worst quality. They look and feel nothing like the Huggies I purchased at Target. They feel like plastic and do not stop leakage. See pictures below. I hope Huggies will investigate this product and replace it. I hope Amazon will refund my purchase. Do NOT buy these diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Megan S.

customer_reviews.title: Huggies ?
customer_reviews.text: Did not receive 140 Huggies newborn diapers. Received 112, the other 28 were of no name. 70 came in protective plastic the others were loose in the box.
customer_reviews.author: ElleMarie

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THESE!!!  READ THE REVIEWS
customer_reviews.text: We have used Huggies before and these are terrible. Not sure if Amazon got some knock offs sold to them or Huggies just went down hill. We change our little one often and with these it seems every time they leak. Can’t keep her in them at night as she will leak through multiple diapers in a night. I should have returned them right away. DON’T BUY THESE YOU WILL USE TWICE AS MANY AND HAVE LEAKS EACH TIME! Time for a new brand. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Seals

customer_reviews.title: Feel guilty for putting these on my child
customer_reviews.text: I second the reviewer who feels as if these are fake Huggies. After using Huggies in the hospital, I bought these for home. These are not absorbent at all. At every change my son's skin would be covered with his urine or stool. He had multiple leaks at night and up the back during the day. My son ended up getting a horrible diaper rash that wouldn't go away no matter what we did. As soon as we changed to Pampers it vanished. I feel guilty for ever putting these on my child. I'm hopeful that this was a fluke and not actually a product Huggies is putting out. Unfortunately, I will never give them another opportunity to find out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good absorption, no leakage, snug fit, helpful wetness indicator, value for money.
customer_reviews.text: I was wary of the product since the reviews were varying. However, I decided to give it a try since the price could not be beat, and I am glad. I tried the diaper for my premie baby who is nearing 6 pounds now, and it fits him perfectly. The absorption is good and we haven’t had any leaks, and my baby boy pees and poos a lot. I love the design, it’s cute. I love the wetness indicator. Only one complaint, make the closing tabs a different color for convenience.
customer_reviews.author: EwT

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, just like the other Huggies we've used
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the snug & dry instead of our usual swaddlers by accident, had no issues with them at all and would buy again. I was nervous to try given the news articles I had read about them causing horrible reactions in babies, but for the price difference I wanted to at least give one a try. Writing this review to put other mommies at ease if you are considering buying these - there were absolutely no adverse effects to using them for us. We used the whole box without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Thin, Flimsy, Expect Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Having previously purchased Huggies Snug and Dry diapers in the past and liking the product, I was especially happy to find a super box for the price Amazon had listed. After receiving the product though, I am extremely disappointed. Huggies has changes the diaper format, and they are now very thin and flimsy, with very little absorbency in the front of the diaper. I have a little guy, and I need diapers that are more absorbent in the front to stop leaks. We will not or purchasing this variation of Huggies again.
customer_reviews.author: Krazy Katz

customer_reviews.title: Huggies is Always #1 in My Eyes
customer_reviews.text: The cost of living here in Hawaii is ridiculous, even if you do have a decent job without the struggle, prices will always be much higher here. I'm happy to be able to provide the Island of O'ahu Huggies Diapers,Wipes and Overnites at a lower cost because of my membership with Amazon. I have sold more than a thousand boxes of diapers and have met many friends because of this. I am a Single Mother of 2, also going to school part-time and this has become a wonderful experience for me. I only wish to do even greater things for fellow Mom's and future Mom's as well!!
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: think twice
customer_reviews.text: my daughter used huggies snug and dry from the stores from when she was 3 months old to about 13 months...thats when I ran out and went to LUVS (which i love) i saw these at a reasonable price with the s&s discount and a 20% discount at the time so i purchased 2 and am so dissatisfied. paper paper thin and my daughter got rash first time we started using them
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii Prime Mom

customer_reviews.title: Leaks! Butt sores.
customer_reviews.text: I have had Amazon for a long time and I think this is the first time I have ever written a review. This particular Huggies diaper ia horrible. It leaks almost every time. Furthermore, butt sores and skin peeling started appearing and looked like it was never going to go away until I switched back to Pampers Swaddlers. Pampers Swaddlers is best due to the netting they have. The pooped soaks through the netting, keeping it somewhat away from the butt cheek. I believe the netting helps keep the poop from being pushed out (leakage) and possibly help prevent butt sores. In my experience, I am staying with Pampers Swaddlers until I find something just as good or better.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Robles

customer_reviews.title: no complaints
customer_reviews.text: I have used huggies diapers for my son since Day 1. He is now 6 months. I like these because they are comfortable for him, and also have a low price point. I haven't had too many issues with leaking, at least no more than any other brand (obviously babies will have blowouts every now and then!). I am not the biggest fan of the mickey mouse design on the diapers - i would prefer something plain and simple, but it doesn't bother me that much because they work. I order mine via Subscribe and Save which allows me to save 20%.
customer_reviews.author: thegirlwhoruns

customer_reviews.title: This was not a good quality daiper.
customer_reviews.text: At first I had rated 5 stars. I lowered because this purchase time I have had several wet daiper "blow outs" the outer material seems to desintegrate within minutes of getting wet so when my toddler happens to wet her daiper while eating or sleeping for example, I have to stop her activity imediately upon seing the swell in the daiper because it will soon be a huge mess. She also now has a rash so bad it's bleeding. I've never seen her cry so much it breaks my heart. I cancelled my subscription. I'll have to try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Vital

customer_reviews.title: First time mom approves!
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a Pampers kind of girl, but Huggies Snug & Dry has won me over. I have a newborn baby who now weighs 9lbs 14oz and he fits perfectly in the newborn size. The diaper curves his thighs and waist in just the right areas. We haven't had any blow outs since using these. No reactions. Nothing but pure perfection. When your baby urinates, the blue stripe will appear boldly. I would highly recommend these diapers!
customer_reviews.author: Brocko

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, maybe not for all, but good enough for me
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about the newborn diapers, but the size 4 we got did not look like the ones in the pictures. Aside from the darker (red and black) colors, they work and feel the same. We've bought these in stores and sometimes they'll have the more colorful prints, but they're essentially the same for a child that isn't sensitive. Some might complain about the sagging when it's full, but it really should just be changed at that point. Some might also prefer Pampers, but those tend to leak out the back for us. These might feel a bit wet when soiled, but they don't really leak if overfull. Overall, satisfied with this purchase and would most likely order again.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah W.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible, gel doesn’t stay in.
customer_reviews.text: I would give zero stars if I could, these diapers are that lousy. After the first night I regretted buying these. They claim 12 hours of protection, but my son woke up soaked through. Not only that, but the gel keeps coming out of the diapers after just a short time. He has been getting rashes, and I’m so disappointed. We never had these problems with the pampers baby dry diapers, and won’t stray from them again. I even think the Walmart brand of diapers we bought between deliveries were far superior to these Huggies, they kept my son dry and the gel stayed in the diaper. I will never purchase huggies again.
customer_reviews.author: gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: Leak and rash
customer_reviews.text: Hated these diapers. I usually use Luvs and recently saw these were on sale so I gave them a try. They have a my son a horrible rash then I remembered that huggies brand caused him a rash when he was a baby and obviously at two still does. Now I’m stuck with 100 diapers. And they also Leaks terribly. Only reason I didn’t give it one star is cause I’ve still seen worse. But between the rash and leak these are a hard PASS. I’ll stick to LUVS
customer_reviews.author: STEPHANIE

customer_reviews.title: Well trusted brand
customer_reviews.text: Never had an issue with this brand. I mean yeah accidental pooplosian happened just like with any brand but never had an issue like a skin rush. Of course there were numerous skin rushes but caused by excrements and acidic pee In this modern and fast world we opt for a quick clean up with wipes rather than washing babys bottom. Many don't realize that wipes have some chemicals in them and combined with diaper additives give kids nasty rashes. I always did and still wash my little ones bottom even after pee in a bathroom sink. I wipe her poopy bottom before washing... don't want to dirty my hands lol Try and see you will be surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Live, love, laugh 🖖Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as Huggies but good price.
customer_reviews.text: All of the hospitals I have gone to usually stock pampers newborn diapers. But Huggies usually has cheaper prices. These diapers luckily lasted us about 2 weeks before we upgraded to size 1. We thought 140 would be too many diapers but it actually worked out. Our newborn was going through about 8-10 diapers a day.. which lasted about 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksdude

customer_reviews.title: (1) It smells bad. chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: I only give two stars, the reason is that: (1) It smells bad. chemical smell; (2) every two or three weeks at night the diaper leak pee, and my son would wake up in the middle of night with a wet pajamas and the bed, it is very disturbing. We have used the Huggies for two years, and for the last one year we have ordered from the same seller - this one. I just wanna say it is very disappointing, and honestly, in the past I had confidence in the HUGGIES, now I just don't know what to do? any suggestions? Thanks,
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: Smells like burnt rubber
customer_reviews.text: I like huggies but this is the first time I purchased them through Amazon and they are obviously poor quality. There is a disturbing smell that emanates from them when they are soiled. Like burning rubber or burnt plastic or something like that. Also, I'm noticing the diaper gets hot. It's as if there is an actual chemical reaction going on when it is soiled and it heats up and starts burning. Needless to say this is my last diaper purchase on Amazon, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brodsky

customer_reviews.title: Good diapers. Haven’t had any leaking or poopy blow ...
customer_reviews.text: Good diapers. Haven’t had any leaking or poopy blow outs. I love the little color change strip so I can just peak and see if my little one needs to be changed. I can’t vouch for the up to 12hr protection because I change my baby’s diapers so often. I’m glad I bought the jumbo pack because so far she’s gone through three diapers in less than an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Absobant and Rash Free Diapers
customer_reviews.text: I have used many different brands of diapers for my kids. Pampers/Luvs/Member Mark/Up n Up etc are just few of them. Cost and quality both are balanced in case of Huggies. My kids never had any issues of rashes except one or two events. Even during nights or heavy diaper cases, it hardly leaked anytime. Its not super soft but it never created any skin issues either. I must have bought at least 150 boxes of diapers altogether so far. Only countable few lots had some trouble with quality when it reached home crossing different stages of manufacturing/storing/processing/shipping. I would only recommend Huggies whenever I need to.
customer_reviews.author: MindfulShopping

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware You May Receive Old Diapers
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been ordering Huggies diapers from Amazon for a couple of years. Unfortunately this last box was old. The silica beads were coming out of the diaper after minimal wetness giving our kiddo a bad diaper rash. Amazon customer service was great and gave us a full refund. This may have been a fluke but I will not be ordering huggies from Amazon again since we can not guarantee the age of the diapers. I have given this 5 stars because huggies are still, and will always be, the best diapers for both their ability to contain leaks and great value. We have tried the other name brands, store brands and organic brands but Huggies is still the best!
customer_reviews.author: setapartshigyo

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent deal for the amount of diapers, but it comes with a price. These Huggies are not as soft as their counterpart, the Huggies with Winnie the Pooh on it. These feel much more stiff and there must be some chemical reaction when you're in hits the liner inside the diaper. It smells like wet grass which makes me wonder what chemical is on my baby's skin. As far as containment, it does the job. If you're looking for something that gives you the most bang for your buck, I suppose buying these would be cost-effective, but the quality is poor.
customer_reviews.author: janowacki

customer_reviews.title: Worst diapers ever.
customer_reviews.text: We have been using Pampers for my toddlers whole life. Never had issues. With potty training around the corner, I decided to save a couple bucks and buy these. Horrible decision!!! We have been using them for a few weeks now and they have leaked different 7 times, including poop coming out the sides. They are a waste of money. Do not buy these diapers. We are just trying to get through them now. Just useless. I bought some more Pampers, just to wear at night and to town because they dont leak.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Annin

customer_reviews.title: Not my choice
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion Huggies has really gone downhill with in making their diapers and when I had my babies back in the 2000 I was such a huge fan but whatever they did to change their diapers they failed at it and now I am no longer at the end of Huggies diapers and I would rather buy generic diapers vs. Huggies they are not absorbent they leak and they average Hennessy a breaking out children
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hicks

customer_reviews.title: We hated these! My 1 year old has never had ...
customer_reviews.text: We hated these! My 1 year old has never had diaper rash until we tried these a few weeks ago. Since then shes broken out a few times. These have leaked in 2 hours, pampers can go all night without leaking. Poop even leaked out the side when she didn't even poop that much. As soon as she pees in the huggies you can smell pee. We liked the huggies they used at the hospital but these ones were terrible. Will be going back to pampers for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Chasity

customer_reviews.title: FAKE
customer_reviews.text: Our family loves Huggies diapers, they are all we use. Because they are all we use, I KNOW I am not misleading anyone by saying that what came today are NOT Huggies diapers. The box says Huggies. The diapers say Huggies. These are not. These knock offs are thin, they smell like bug spray and frankly they arent even a decent attempt at a fake. Walmarts 'parents choice' are higher in quality. The ONLY positive thing I can comment to is that so-far Amazon has made my return easy and straight forward.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Ok if you really don’t have money for other options.
customer_reviews.text: Overall 3 stars. Based on 5 qualities rating. Price: 1 star. They are good for what you pod for, can’t denied it. Leak protection: 0 stars. Baby pee all over crib with first diaper try, not even 6 hours of the “12 hour” claim protection. Comfortability: 1 star. Baby looks good and comfty on those. Size: 1 star. Adequate size for baby weight (mine is 6.8 pounds) and fitted just right. Material: 0 stars. It’s just to thin. asked for a refund, I’m mad at myself that i bought those for my poor baby.
customer_reviews.author: CustomerO

customer_reviews.title: Huggies win over pampers!!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried 5 different brands and also cloth diapers. These are the most absorbent and best value for money. Pampers consistently leak and are very cold on my babies bottom when she wakes up in the night, huggies do not do that. They absorb well. The only downside is sometimes I find absorbent crystals on babies bottom.. Even when it's only been 2 hours or more so. The fit is not as good as pampers. Huggies kind of slip off baby butt and the side straps do a weird thing. Huggies side straps are much stronger than pampers. The biggest plus for huggies is that they are unscented! Pampers smell like crap. Also huggies have better price point.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffa

customer_reviews.title: Diapers that leak
customer_reviews.text: I got these for a great price. We usually use Pampers brand diapers (Pampers Swaddlers to be exact). Since the price was good, I bought some for my 2 year old. I really did not like these diapers at all. They fit fine, but they leaked a lot. We could not use here at bedtime, even with 1-2 diaper changes overnight. They always felt wet on the outside, even when there wasn't much inside. I am changing her every hour now just to prevent leakage. I am switching back to Pampers Swaddlers now because of these issues. The only pro is the price in my opinion. I realize these work good for others, but not my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: JennaTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what happened to Huggies Snug and Dry, but the new version is horrid. My baby would wake up with tiny pieces of glue or whatever the material that they are using now on his skin, this is only after 6-7 hs of wear at night. The sticky substance that supposed to be inside the diaper somehow leaks and ends up on baby's skin and eventually irritates and you have a diaper rash or worse. Don't buy. Even though it's cheaper, but not worth the irritation of baby's skin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Box came in a brown Huggies box. All the diapers were good per usual. I didnt notice anything different. Even though it does say last 8 hours or overnight, don't let your child bathe in their urine, that's how they'll end up with an UTI. Overall, awesome diapers. They're my go-to diaper. Oh! And a big appluse to Amazon delivery person!! I was away from home and worried my package would be stolen since I live on an intersection. But a delivery picture came through and they HID my package away from public view for me!! A sigh of relief.. thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Kim

customer_reviews.title: Color rubs onto the skin and hard to wash out, takes a week to eventually get the color off the skin.
customer_reviews.text: This is terrible. We have many cases of the blue Micky mouth print from the outside color rubbed off to our son's inside of the legs. The blue color is very difficult to wash out in his bath. And we are concerned about his health with this. We've used huggies bought from Costco for over 18 months and never had a single case like this. But this package from Amazon is having a lot of issues and we will not purchase diapers from Amazon again, we worry it might not even be authentic to have multiple problems like this. We have to throw the rest of the diapers out. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Value-oriented Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic! I got the snug and dry 140 count Huggies. I used Pampers with my first and so I started using Pampers again with my second but I saw these for $20 nd just couldn't pass up that price. They are fantastic. Not only is the price amazing but the Pampers were causing my daughter to get really bad rash on her butt. These seem to absorb her watery poop 10x better and her rash is completely gone. I will not be going back to Pampers.
customer_reviews.author: E. Saari

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. We’ve used Huggies since she was born and had zero problems but we haven’t used the ‘Snug and dry’ version. Maybe just a bad batch, but I HATE these diapers. Every diaper change, the gel from inside the diaper is in my daughters genital area I have to clean out, and have given her the first diaper rash ever because of it. We cloth diaper now as these were a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great Quality! I have really been using Luvs for most of my sons life and ordered these Huggies to try. I was impressed! They look like they hold and form more comfortably to a very wiggley toddler and do not pull at the legs like other brands. Even my husband noticed the difference and said he liked these diapers. I will be making the switch to Huggies from now on and use this brand for my NB daughter too.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle.engelskirger

customer_reviews.title: I am a long-time Huggies user. I am on ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a long-time Huggies user. I am on my second child and have always used Huggies Snugglers and Little Movers. I decided to give the Snug and Dry a shot with my 7 week old. They are by far less absorbent than the other two kinds. We have used 5 diapers out of the pack and I wish I could return them. When I pick her up to change her the pee squishes out (I change after every feed which is no more than 3 hours or when I see the line is blue). They do not hold as well as the Snugglers or Little Movers. Will not be trying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen H.

customer_reviews.title: Way better than Pampers
customer_reviews.text: So, I have seen all those Pampers commercials where they show the baby waking at 3am because they are wet (in competitors diapers) versus Pampers where they sleep through the night. So, I found Pampers for cheap on Amazon and used them with my twin boys. Well, I have been through a a few cases of Pampers and a case of Huggies and both my boys will make it through the night in Huggies and they consistently woke up wet through to their clothes and beds with Pampers. Also Huggies causes less rashes and have way less chemical or fake powder smells; they just smell clean. I am so happy I found them cheaper than Pampers on subscribe and save!
customer_reviews.author: Texas Kate

customer_reviews.title: Buy little movers instead
customer_reviews.text: The sizing on Huggies snug and dry is way off. I had to buy a size six just for the length but the waist was to big. My baby is about average size so this just didn't make sense and I am not a newbie by any means with diapers. We simply switched to Huggies little movers and suddenly the sizing matched (size 4 was perfect for my 10/11 month old). Yeah, I know this is a size 5 review, so, know that we had problems with this sizzling to and had to quickly move on the the size 6 because of blowouts up the back (not enough length).
customer_reviews.author: natalie

customer_reviews.title: What happened to Huggies?
customer_reviews.text: It would be a lie to say that these diapers are not absorbent. they contain little gel beads that soak up a large amount of urine. This causes the diaper to sag and by morning you will find little gel beads in the feet of the pajamas. During the day you will find little gel beads throughout the play area. I was told after contacting Huggies that these are non-toxic beads. That really did not consult me, I don't want our baby eating any beads. my money was refunded after the diapers were returned.
customer_reviews.author: The Girl Geek

customer_reviews.title: these are the most affordable type of Huggies you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are fine. I would choose them over another brand. I usually get the Huggies movers, and I like them better than these. These are great for the price. My only big minus with these is that the black Mickey Mouse shows through light colored clothing/pants. I wish they were light gray instead of so black.
customer_reviews.author: MaryWHicks13

customer_reviews.title: Bad smell
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 1 month old because I'd read they are slightly bigger than Pampers Swaddlers, and the NB Pampers had gotten so tight on her! The Huggins do fit much better. However, we got about halfway through the box and noticed baby girl was smelling really bad with every diaper change. Turns out, it was the diapers. Even the clean ones straight out of the box has this weird metallic smell! I'll finish off the box, but after that I won't be using Huggies anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Almost 5 stars but the leaking and lint is a problem
customer_reviews.text: We switched from Target brand only because of the convenience of delivery not for quality. They are about the same on quality. I do like that the Huggies are not as bulky as other diapers. My daughter (21 mos) seems to move really well in them. My only 2 issues is minor leaking (which was never a problem with Target diapers) and the stuffing comes off the diaper and sticks to her. There are always white lint pieces on her now. This is the only case I've noticed the lint though so I gave 4 stars instead of 5. If it happens again I will probably switch back to Target brand.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick McTighe

customer_reviews.title: and I really like Huggies Movers
customer_reviews.text: We've used a lot of diapers over the years, and I really like Huggies Movers. We did NOT like their Newborn version. The mesh kept sticking to the little one's tushie. We had a much better experience with Newborn diapers by Pampers and Target brand (oddly our favorite!). Once the kids get walking though, we like the Huggies brand again.
customer_reviews.author: California Momma

customer_reviews.title: High Dislike
customer_reviews.text: These diapers suck. They are rough and not very flexible. They also leaked most of the time. Especially, when baby had a huge poop in one go. These really need to be called "Huggies Loose and Wet Diapers".
customer_reviews.author: haha_yeahTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Absorbency questionable.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t love these diapers. They do okay. I don’t believe they as absorbent as they claim to be. Pampers baby dry was my preferred choice and use (Feb 2016 until last three months). Pampers changed the make of them slightly which while thinner for weight with a new quilted weave are not as absorbent either. This has left me on a journey of finding a new diaper. So far Huggies overnight is closest to the prior making baby dry pampers. This may be good for size 1 or 2. I do not recommend otherwise. (PS. We journal every diaper change due to diet so we see the intake of food/beverage and output use of diapers.)
customer_reviews.author: KipKip

customer_reviews.title: Size 4 had wetness indicating...
customer_reviews.text: I got it seems miss print on size 4 has wetness indicating I thought was only in 1 and 2 but other than that loves these diapers. Never diaper rash or anything no leaks this is third time brought from Amazon. Love subscribe and save also.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: better prices then costco
customer_reviews.text: i used to buy diapers from costco. people were telling me its cheaper online. I always read reviews bwfore purchases so i was scared getting these due to poor reviews. gave it a chance and bought a pack, then two.. so forth. i have twins so these run out super fast. the prices with amazon fluctuates so im careful to buy it only when on sale. so for the price, its great. does the job and no leaks, no problem. plus, it has the indication line that im so used to and cant live without now. i only purchase from amazon and not other vendors if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Beltran

customer_reviews.title: Good for our potty-training resistant child.
customer_reviews.text: If you are shopping for size 6 diapers, you, too, must be in the "where have I failed as a parent?" club that I find myself in. lol After having 5 children and babysitting plenty of others, I can say this...kids potty train at a WIDE variety of ages and some are just slow...yep, that's our 4th child..in no hurry to potty train no matter what incentives I throw out there! Oh well..she is likely to get it at some point, right?! In the meantime, these Huggies are helpful. They are not terrific...but her skin reacts less to these and they do a decent job. Priced per diaper they are decent, too.
customer_reviews.author: GadgetFamily

customer_reviews.title: Worst diapers we tried
customer_reviews.text: I have been on the hunt for diapers for my son. Tried every single brand available on Amazon and even the WholeFoods brand too. These are really bad! I would honestly say that they are my least favorite. They aren’t soft to the touch, you can feel the grainy gel inside, and they don’t hold in my 6 month old’s poop. All the other diapers we tried were infinitely better If you like huggies, go for the night time or 360 cruisers but stay away from this one. Glad it was on sale because we won’t be using them!
customer_reviews.author: FurBabyMama

customer_reviews.title: Huggies not as dry of a diaper as they used to be
customer_reviews.text: Although these Huggies diapers arrived quickly, the product has changed over the years and not for the best. These diapers are good for about 1 to 3 hours too no longer than that or they experience leak through and discomfort as my beautiful grandbaby suddenly starts tossing and turning about that 3rd hour to let you know that the diaper is wet and I do mean wet to feel on the outside. I was sorely disappointed after using Huggies with my children.
customer_reviews.author: Glo

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst diapers I have bought. I have never had ones that sag, leak, come undone and fall apart so consistently. I purchased one box, an half way through it and ready to give the rest away, I am so sick of them. I have to change within an hour or less, only because they are falling of my kids body. She's 18 months old and nothing out of the ordinary as far as useage goes. So worth it to spend an extra free dollars and get the little movers or whatever is next up. Definitely not buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Review of Poo Catchers.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice diapers. They were stretchy and held the liquid that was being emitted from the lower half of my child. These did this regardless of the sun's position (worked fine both day and night) The only issue with these arose from operator error - some how we missed including the baby's behind in the diaper when we did the midnight change. The newborn sported an awfully large plumbers crack - yet amazingly there was no leaks. I would purchase again. Yes I am reviewing poo catchers for my mini me.
customer_reviews.author: Xu Hawj

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy, cheap, not the usual Huggies quality (we've used Huggies for years). Thought this deal was too good to be true and it was! The diaper is super thin and has no support or form when worn, so the back is constantly riding up and causing wedgies - uncomfortable for the toddler and a MESSY situation for #2's. Also felt the need to change more often because they fill up with pee so fast and it gets a deformed shape - just weird. Won't be purchasing again. Good quality is worth a few extra $$.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Smith

customer_reviews.title: Only good for a diaper cake
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the negative reviews... we still decided to buy these because it was a great price for the amount of diapers AND it was a mistake. The very first diaper leaked, The wetness indicator was still dry and #2 still managed to leak out of a dry diaper. After continuing using these, 2 out of 3 times they will leak even if you change right away. Don’t use these on your kid unless you want to change sheets and clothes repeatedly.
customer_reviews.author: Richy

customer_reviews.title: We've used Huggies for 3 years now
customer_reviews.text: We are a Huggies family for sure. They've worked the best and been our favorite since the first one in the hospital. We've tried multiple other brands and always came back Huggies. Even now that potty training is working we still use these at sleep times or on long car trips or in places there are no restrooms readily available. The subscribe and save here on Amazon is a great deal, too! Thanks for that!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: We don't love these ones as much as the little movers. They seem to roll up on our very active 2 year old. which makes his pee kind of leak thru at the top, which is annoying. It's not a ton of leakage, but enough to be a pain. Definitely won't be buying these again. We will stick with the little movers.
customer_reviews.author: S. Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Work good
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gift for an adoption party and was unsure what size to get because their child was right in the middle of both sizes it seemed based on weight. My friend let me know that the size 4 diapers fit great for their 30lb son. The Mickeys are also adorable on the diapers. They so far have held up all night with no leaks, though they did have a diarrhea leak out the leg holes. The only reason I am giving a 4 star instead of 5, is that they aren't as soft as some other diapers she received at the party.
customer_reviews.author: Chessie

customer_reviews.title: Horrible...0 stars
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are horrible. We have several leaks EVERY SINGLE DAY (and that is no exaggeration). Snug and Dry they are not. I'm having to change my son's pants every day and also having to clean up that gel insides from all over the floor. I bought 2 boxes and I am returning 1. Really wish I could return. This other one. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Knitra1980

customer_reviews.title: Much Thinner than Other Huggies Diapers
customer_reviews.text: I have only used these on my kiddo for a couple days, but they are not like the ones I have purchased in stores. These are not as soft, they are much thinner comparable to LUVS. Bummed I purchased 2 large cases of these because they are not what I was expecting. Highly recommend spending the extra money on the Huggies Overnites instead as they NEVER LEAK! Disappointed in Huggies with this particular product.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Shockley

customer_reviews.title: Cheap !!!!
customer_reviews.text: THE ONLY REASON THIS PRODUCT GOT ONE STAR IS BECAUSE IT WAS REQUIRED. THESE ARE BY FAR THE WORST DIAPERS I HAVE EVER PURCHASED. THEY ARE THIN AND CHEAP. THE LATCHES BROKE ON MOST OF THE DIAPERS. MY SON HAS HAD MORE ACCIDENTS WITH THE DIAPERS ON THEN WHEN THEY WERE OFF. DISGUSTING I WILL NEVER EVER PURCHASE THESE AGAIN!!! I CHANGE HIM TWICE AS MUCH AND WITHIN MINUTES HIS DIAPER IS SOAKED. OH AND LETS NOT FORGET THAT THE LITTLE MATERIAL THAT THEY USE TO SOAK UP HIS PEE COMES OUT THE DIAPER AND THEN ITS ALL OVER HIS BUTT... THESE CLEAE GEL LIKE LOOKING BALLS. IM HIGHLY DISSAPPOINTED.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal V

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper out there overall for the price and quality
customer_reviews.text: This is honestly the best all around diaper pricewise and fit wise. This diaper seems more flexible than others and has been more successful in keeping blowouts to a minimum in my kids. Also the outside of the diaper still feels dry even in the morning after a long night.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua S.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Non Absorbant. Will not buy again
customer_reviews.text: These are HORRIBLE. These diapers are thin and I have to change my toddler constantly. They sag and have zero snugness around the thighs. I only bought these because they were the cheapest diaper prices I could find on Amazon and I recently moved somewhere where I can’t buy affordable diapers at the store. I even did a subscribe and save and cancelled almost immediately. It’s upsetting to buy diapers that have little absorbency. I’m very disappointed and upset that my son keeps setting through all of his clothes within an hour. Do not buy these unless you want a cheap product.
customer_reviews.author: courtney

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: I've always tried most diaper brands. This is my fourth child and it's safe to say I know what I'm doing. I've even cloth diapered with success. Huggies have always fit my kids perfectly and the tabs are awesome. I've never had one leak or blow out on me. I'm not going to sit and diss other brands because everyone has their own opinions on what worked for them and their family. Mine is such: I prefer Huggies over any other brand because they've withheld anything that my children have blown out. From poops to pee, it's held it in.
customer_reviews.author: Ewizzle

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite diaper
customer_reviews.text: These diapers work very well but the only thing that I don't like is that the waist tabs (that hold the diaper on) curls back into the diaper meaning into the poop/pee if you don't catch them first. If that happens such is often you can't roll up the dirty diaper and hold it closed with the waist tabs. I have two kids and have used alot of different diapers and this is the only one that does that. I will not be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: NCP

customer_reviews.title: Great Diapers and Best Value
customer_reviews.text: These are our favorite diapers. We tried a different very popular brand but Huggies are better. The baby is dry and feels comfortable. No leaking. Good product and a very reasonable price. Best value for diapers. P.S. Don't ever get diapers with the yellow line that indicates that the baby peed. In order for this line to change color (become darker), the diapers are made of thin material and they stay wet. The baby gets easily irritated by the feeling of wetness and you know what's next :) You'll also go through them too fast and need more and more....Just get Huggies Snug and Dry. This is the better, money saving choice that guarantees a happier baby.
customer_reviews.author: Mariya Mar

customer_reviews.title: So much elastic all the pooh comes out the legs and onto clothes
customer_reviews.text: Every child fits diapers differently. That being said, these have so much elastic around the legs that all pooh comes straight out the sides. These were perfect for my son, they are horrible on my daughter. If you let them get too wet, little particles will appear on your kid (the moisture collection particles from inside the diaper). Won't be buying these again. I like the Target Up and Up brand now. They hold a whole lot more now, they keep the pooh contained, and they are made of natural materials, so more biodegradable. Oh, and they are super affordable!
customer_reviews.author: LeyaRuth

customer_reviews.title: Hughes
customer_reviews.text: this is by far the best deal I have. I am a mom of four and i barely have time to go out and shoot for diaper neither have time to search for coupons. So if you are a mommy in a rush like me consider subscribing you won't regret it. Another thing is you have to verify the delivery days sometimes you will need them before the days you expect it, so make sure you update the date and you will not have to worry about diapers. Oh and totally forgot the amount for the price you can't beat that :)
customer_reviews.author: Delays

customer_reviews.title: Very much got what I paid for
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these accidentally, thinking I was ordering the "little snugglers," so that's on me. These diapers are not soft, and do not absorb anything more than urine. I had to deal with at least two blowouts a day with diapers because they do not CONTAIN anything. I've just stopped using them and plan to donate them somewhere. My advice is that if you value your time and don't want to spend your days cleaning diaper contents off of clothing, stick with Pampers swaddlers.
customer_reviews.author: K. B

customer_reviews.title: Terrible leak protection
customer_reviews.text: These are a much lower quality diaper than the Huggies diapers I’m accustomed to using. They have terrible leak protection and must be changed every few hours in an effort to prevent leaks so we’re using many more diapers in a day than usual. I’ve used Little Snugglers and Huggies that had a different Mickey Mouse design (maybe Little Movers?) and did not have nearly as many leaks. Compared to other Huggies the fit is odd too. For a better price point I’ll stick with Kirkland brand diapers.
customer_reviews.author: PNW_Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good value!
customer_reviews.text: Good diapers! They do seem to leak (always a #2 leak..) a bit more than huggies little movers. But these are a great value. No scent, and very soft. Our little one wears these during the day when she has more frequent diaper changes and we put overnights on at night. We have occasionally used these overnight and (so far) no leaks. These have the Blue line wetness indicator as well.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda E

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I real dislike these diapers. I used Huggins with my other 2 kids, but my last is 6 yrs old. now. I have been using Pampers Snugglers (now size 2) with my 4 month old since he was born. Huggies however were on sale, so I ordered them. They came with a cute design, Mickey Mouse, and the wet diaper indicator line, which is kind of useful, but similar to Pampers. Then we used them...they’re stiff, bulky, hang lower and always leak out overnight. I’m so disappointed and will not order again.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these but since using these diapers my son he has had a diaper rash. I didn’t think it was because of the diapers at first. But when I used a different brand for a few days then went back to these his rash came back again. And let me add since he was born he had all of one slight diaper rash until these and he’s 1.5 years old. I did however like the way the diaper fits him. The strap that comes across was smooth and didn’t cut into his leg which was a problem I had with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I recently ran out and had to run to the store to grab a pack until my new order came in. I bought pampers because they were on sale, big mistake for me and my little one. They feel very flimsy and generic and don’t absorb very well. Besides that and the oddness or seeing the front gel wet with pee because it’s see through. These are going to be my go to!
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy these!!!!
customer_reviews.text: They constantly leak. We want our money back and will buy the little snugglers instead. These are JUNK! It’s like they are water repellant and everything travels right out of the diaper and up my baby’s back, and all over the bed or his clothes. I woke up at 1am to a soaking wet baby, and a soaking wet crib, and the wetness indicator on the diaper was still yellow. The baby was wet all the way to his head. I’m extremely unhappy about these diapers and I bought over 200. Definitely will be returning them, so angry about this.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: These are cheaply made diapers! Surely they arent real huggies. The first couple diapers were ok even though they even feel different than regular huggies. But now I've had several that when wet have the inside stuff come out in clumps on my son. Do not buy these!
customer_reviews.author: summer

customer_reviews.title: Higher price than originally paid but good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Update.... when I originally purchased these as a size three some of them had hard plastic pieces that poked through the back of the diaper poking my baby’s back and some of the tabs would come off when trying to close the diaper. Now it seems to be better when purchasing but they are more expensive. Last month I purchased 192 size 4 diapers for the same $32 price that I am now only receiving 154 diapers. The quality seems to be good otherwise. They don’t leak and fit well. I am overall happy with the item and will continue purchasing regardless of the price hike.
customer_reviews.author: Lali

customer_reviews.title: Not per the description, terrible.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 7 month old grandson I normally purchase huggies little snugglers, I bought these for overnight protection because it stated they had 12 hours of protection.The first time I used these they lasted for about 6 hours, so to give them a change I used my other diaper which last around 6.5 hours before having baby awaken with wet clothes and sheets, gave the snug & dry another try and used for day and night time and could only get about 5 hours without wet clothes and sheets.Please don"t purchase if you want your child to be able to sleep in them for more than 5 hours. I would never purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: ms66min

customer_reviews.title: Run!!!!
customer_reviews.text: There are absolutely no stars that should be given to this diaper. If you want your child to end up with a rash, then buy it. Listen to the other buyers. This diaper is rubbish. The same thing happened to me. They are as thin as paper. By the time your child does one good pee it’s over, and the gel from the diaper comes out and the pee often leaks on clothes. It cannot hold anything. This diaper cannot last 1 hour much less 30 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Marck

customer_reviews.title: Not very absorbent!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using luvs for a while but last time I came to look for diapers on Amazon the Huggies were cheaper. I used Huggies little snugglers before with no problems but these snug and dry have not been good for us. They do not absorb as well I have had several leaks with the diaper no where near overfull. Any my child's privates hold the moisture not the diaper her skin is always wet when I change the diaper which is something never noticed with any other brand diaper. Definitely going back to luvs.
customer_reviews.author: ShannonP

customer_reviews.title: Love huggies, but these cant be real huggie diapers.
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE. I love huggies, they only leak if I dont strap them on correctly. Even if the diaper is extremely full IT WILL NOT leak through like other diaper brands (including pampers.) BUT these exact diapers I received last week are terrible. When I went to change the first diaper after my son peed in it I seen tiny pieces of gel all over his bum and the diaper. The weird thing is that the diaper wasnt ripped. Disgusting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dependable brand
customer_reviews.text: These are the only brand I usually use with my grandchildren and there has never been any problems with diaper rash. Snug at the legs without causing discomfort, yet will hold up well to episodes of diarrhea. If you use the proper size they should always hold up well to leaks. Dependable brand that is easy to put on baby.
customer_reviews.author: Christine K. Cornett-McVay

customer_reviews.title: Size 5 are horrible diapers compared to all previous sizes
customer_reviews.text: We used Huggies from newborn size all the way now to size 5 and never had an issue until we changed from size 4 to size 5. The diapers are visually different and feel different. They lack any quality the previous sizes had, they give our daughter major rush and they feel like rough paper, they don't hold the liquid in and the soiled diapers spill over. Horrible product, what ever happened between size 4 and size 5 it's not good!
customer_reviews.author: 3fan

customer_reviews.title: Not the same Huggies as before.
customer_reviews.text: This are not the same diapers as purchased before. They leak all the time through the diaper! When my baby pees I have to change her entire outfit! Will be purchasing from stores! I waited to use the other box purchased thinking one was defective but both are the same.
customer_reviews.author: P.M.

customer_reviews.title: bad quality
customer_reviews.text: usually buy my huggies through costco. they're good quality, never really had an issue with them, bought these through amazon, and quality sucked, very thin around waist, looked liked they where about to ripp. was not happy at all with them. don't understand why same brand makes different quality for different sellers. does huggies make better quality for costco???
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Deal - Awesome Packaging
customer_reviews.text: This huge box of 276 actually came 6 jumbo packs of 46 diapers, which is awesome because the smaller packs allow you to get them out of the huge box and store them more easily. Also-when I want to give any from my stash as gifts, they still look nice and are in their own packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Karly N Little

customer_reviews.title: the elastic gave my baby a bad rash on her back and upper thighs
customer_reviews.text: Con #1: leaves gel particles all over my baby. Con#2: the elastic gave my baby a bad rash on her back and upper thighs. Just read another review of a mom who has been using Huggies for 18 months and said they changed the elastic and her child got a rash too. Don't know what to do with the box now. I don't have any pros except the price is reasonable but the price is nothing to consider at all if my baby is rashy.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy-Ann James

customer_reviews.title: Moms seal of approval
customer_reviews.text: I find that the Huggies hold the most and have the best leak protection. We have never had issues with them, and we like the snug and dry's because they are not near as big and bulky as the others. Amazon tends to have the best price per diaper as well, if you catch the sales and put it on auto reorder.
customer_reviews.author: jmn27

customer_reviews.title: A winning choice
customer_reviews.text: I like these diapers, I use them on my 2 year old daughter. I orginally started out with Pampers. But, the price for them went up. So I started using these size 4 huggies and have not been disappointed. I especially like the wetness line so you can tell if the diaper has urine in it or not. And I researched a bunch to find the best value with quality for the price. This won the decision. I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: just browsing

customer_reviews.title: Well fitting diapers!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these diapers, I currently use size 4 and 5 of the snug and dry for my two kids. I find the size chart to be a little off, for both my kids but the next size always fits so it works out. My youngest has been sleeping about 10-12 hours at night since he was 2-3 months old and doesn't have problems leaking until he needs to be moved to the next size! They're very soft, well made, and move really well around a baby and very active toddler!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda F.

customer_reviews.title: I am pretty happy with the way these fit my toddler
customer_reviews.text: I am pretty happy with the way these fit my toddler. She is very active and physical but these seem to keep up with her well. They are comparable to the Pampers "Baby Dry" (although the Pampers smell a little weird and you can feel a small amount of moisture through the outer shell of the diaper... which is creepy) in that they are the Huggies version of a budget diaper, (on average .05-.09 cheaper than the Snugglers / Little Mover in the upper end sizes.) Value is important to me and I feel like I get a good value from Huggies specifically when ordering on Amazon by just looking for coupon deals and watching prices.
customer_reviews.author: Kiowagus

customer_reviews.title: Favorite diaper for my littles, especially the ones that like to sleep all night!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this diaper!! I tried pampers on my baby girl and they chapped her skin and leaked at night. My daughters skin isn’t super sensitive either. These diapers last all night and with no irritation. I’d say they are a slim fit compared to other diapers which is what I needed. Love the gather in the back for fit although it does make the tabs fall into the dirty diaper if the poop goes up very far when changing.
customer_reviews.author: Never going in a store again :-)

customer_reviews.title: Could be better. Could be worse.
customer_reviews.text: I honestly prefer Luvs over these Huggies. My baby girl gets rashes if I don't catch the slightest of dirty diapers within moments. This could simply be my daughter's own allergy or some type. These Huggies do absorb well, but run smaller than others I've used. I recommend sizing up for bedtime if you're worried about leaks!
customer_reviews.author: Carly Jude

customer_reviews.title: I changed because I thought they will be a good product after reading some of the reviews
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. Stay with Pampers brand. I changed because I thought they will be a good product after reading some of the reviews. They don’t absorbed much and I have to change my baby diapers every time she pees. It really don’t last for 12 hrs. Also, at night to morning she sleeps 12 hrs straight by the morning the diapers are so wet that it leaks out and it feels very jelly. It’s so bad. I hate the way the gel on this diaper feels when she pees. Hughes needs to do work a lot More on producing a better diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Cole Rockman

customer_reviews.title: Can't be the real Huggies
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these diapers due to the price, but they were terrible. As other reviewers mentioned, these diapers are incredibly thin. I have been buying the same brand and style from Sam's Club and Costco, and I thought the price on these was pretty good, not to mention they were overnight-ed to me. These are definitely not the same. Save yourself the aggravation and go to your local store.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Strong Chemical Smell
customer_reviews.text: These have the worst chemical smell. Even though my baby didn't get a rash or leak in them, the diapers werw giving away. It worries me that I could smell chemical so far away, what is that doing to my baby's delicate area. I don't recommend these & they should be taken off the market. For those who think it was the smell of her urine in the diaper (as so many of my friends told me) I put water on this diaper & had my husband smell it as well. Same chemical smell as before. Again, I don't recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: BJC

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Quality
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the diapers is awful. We use the subscribe feature and get them shipped automatically. It seems like something changed in the last two months. The diapers are flimsy and do not absorb at all! There is a noticeable difference when you hold a Huggies diaper sold at Costco vs. the ones I get monthly. We have to wake up our baby in the middle of the night to change his diaper otherwise he wakes up completely soaked in the morning! I am cancelling my subscription.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Crappy manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: I received my box on Saturday. Out of the 276 diapers 75 of them were defective. They were either torn or missing the tabs on the right side. I had to thoroughly go through all 276 of them and take the damaged ones out.
customer_reviews.author: Redd L

customer_reviews.title: Diaper not good quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these diapers with the impression that they are of the same quality as other Huggies diapers that we have been very pleased with. The diaper appears to be an older model/design and not the same as current Huggies diapers. The diaper does not hold wet/soiled diapers well and they sag. The diapers are thin and while the Mickey Mouse design is appealing, the quality is not quite there. I would not recommend ordering this diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Chavez

product_meta.title: HUGGIES Snug & Dry Diapers, Size 1, 276 Count (Packaging May Vary)
product_meta.description:
Style:Economy Plus Pack| Size:Size 1HUGGIES Size One Snug & Dry Diapers give your baby great protection at a great value. Four layers of protection absorb moisture quickly to help stop leaks for up to 12 hours, and a quilted liner helps to keep your baby dry and comfortable. Plus, Snug & Dry disposable baby diapers have a wetness indicator stripe on the outside that changes from yellow to blue when wet, which helps take the guesswork out of diaper changes. Featuring fun Disney Mickey Mouse designs, Snug & Dry Diapers are available in sizes Newborn (up to 10 lb.), 1 (8-14 lb.), 2 (12-18 lb.), 3 (16-28 lb.), 4 (22-37 lb.), 5 (27+ lb.) and 6 (35+ lb.). Join HUGGIES Rewards to earn points on every pack of HUGGIES diapers and wipes you buy.

BRAND STORY
By Huggies
feature_bullets: Weight Recommendation: 8 - 14 pounds. Featuring fun Disney Mickey Mouse designs, HUGGIES Snug & Dry Diapers Size 1 fit babies from 8 to 14 pound
Trusted Leak Lock system helps eliminate leaks for up to 12 hours
Four layers of protection absorb moisture quickly, and a quilted liner helps keep baby feeling dry
Wetness indicator changes color when it’s time for a diaper change
Pair with HUGGIES Natural Care Wipes to help keep your baby's skin clean and soft
Packaging may vary from image shown
NOTE : "The expiration date is for REWARDS not for the product

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
